title: Quickstart Guide
lede: Get up and running with iMash in just 5 minutes. This guide will walk you through creating your account, setting up your first AI agent, and making your first API call.
whatYouWillLearn: Set up your first AI voice agent
Tested your agent with a phone call

steps.title: Step 1: Create Your iMash Account
steps.content:
First, you'll need to create an account to access the iMash platform.

  1. Visit dashboard.imash.io
  2. Click on "Sign Up" in the top right corner
  3. Enter your email address and create a secure password
  4. Verify your email address by clicking the link sent to your inbox
  5. Complete your profile information

steps.title: Step 2: Navigate to the Dashboard
steps.content:
Once logged in, you'll be directed to your dashboard where you can manage all aspects of your AI agents.

Dashboard Key Areas:

  • Agents: Create and manage your AI voice agents
  • Phone System: Configure phone numbers and SIP providers
  • Campaigns: Set up automated calling campaigns
  • CRM: Manage contacts, leads, and accounts
  • Analytics: View call logs and performance metrics
  • Settings: Configure API keys and account settings

images.caption: The main dashboard showing your agent overview and key metrics
The main dashboard showing your agent overview and key metrics

steps.title: Step 3: Create Your First AI Agent
steps.content:
Let's create your first AI voice agent that can handle phone conversations.

  1. Click on "Agents" in the left sidebar
  2. Click the "+ Create Agent" button
  3. Fill in the agent details:
    • Agent Name: Give your agent a descriptive name (e.g., "Customer Support Agent")
    • Description: Add a brief description of what this agent will do
    • Voice Provider: Select your preferred voice provider (OpenAI, ElevenLabs, etc.)
    • Voice Model: Choose a voice that matches your brand
  4. Configure the agent's behavior:
    • System Prompt: Define how your agent should behave and respond
    • First Message: Set what the agent says when answering a call
    • End Call Phrases: Define phrases that will end the conversation
  5. Click "Save Agent"

Example Agent Configuration:

{
  "name": "Customer Support Agent",
  "voice_provider": "openai",
  "voice_model": "nova",
  "system_prompt": "You are a helpful customer support agent for iMash. Be friendly, professional, and assist customers with their questions about our AI voice platform.",
  "first_message": "Hello! Thank you for calling iMash support. How can I help you today?",
  "end_call_phrases": ["goodbye", "bye", "have a great day", "talk to you later"]
}

images.caption: The agent creation form with configuration options
The agent creation form with configuration options

steps.title: Step 4: Generate Your API Key
steps.content:
To interact with iMash programmatically, you'll need an API key.

  1. Navigate to "Settings" in the left sidebar
  2. Click on "API Keys"
  3. Click "+ Generate New Key"
  4. Give your API key a name (e.g., "Development Key")
  5. Select the appropriate permissions for this key
  6. Click "Generate"
  7. Important: Copy and save your API key immediately - you won't be able to see it again!
⚠️ Security Note:

Keep your API key secure and never expose it in client-side code or public repositories. Treat it like a password.

steps.title: Step 5: Make Your First API Call
steps.content:
Now let's test your API key by making a simple request to list your agents.

Endpointhttps://dashboard.imash.io/api/v2/agents

Try it with different tools:

codeExamples.curl:
# List all your agents
curl -X GET "https://dashboard.imash.io/api/v2/agents" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY"

# Expected Response:
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "agent_abc123",
      "name": "Customer Support Agent",
      "voice_provider": "openai",
      "voice_model": "nova",
      "created_at": "2025-01-09T12:00:00Z"
    }
  ],
  "total": 1,
  "page": 1,
  "limit": 10
}
codeExamples.python:
import requests
import json

# Your API key
api_key = 'YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY'
base_url = 'https://dashboard.imash.io/api/v2'

# List all your agents
response = requests.get(
    f'{base_url}/agents',
    headers={'x-api-key': api_key}
)
agents = response.json()
print('Your agents:', agents)

# Create a new contact
contact_data = {
    'name': 'John Doe',
    'phone': '+15551234567',
    'email': 'john@example.com'
}

response = requests.post(
    f'{base_url}/crm_contacts',
    headers={
        'x-api-key': api_key,
        'Content-Type': 'application/json'
    },
    data=json.dumps(contact_data)
)
contact = response.json()
print('Created contact:', contact)
codeExamples.php:
<?php
$apiKey = 'YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY';
$baseUrl = 'https://dashboard.imash.io/api/v2';

// List all your agents
$ch = curl_init($baseUrl . '/agents');
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
    'x-api-key: ' . $apiKey
]);

$response = curl_exec($ch);
$agents = json_decode($response, true);
curl_close($ch);

echo 'Your agents: ';
print_r($agents);

// Create a new contact
$contactData = [
    'name' => 'John Doe',
    'phone' => '+15551234567',
    'email' => 'john@example.com'
];

$ch = curl_init($baseUrl . '/crm_contacts');
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($contactData));
curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
    'x-api-key: ' . $apiKey,
    'Content-Type: application/json'
]);

$response = curl_exec($ch);
$contact = json_decode($response, true);
curl_close($ch);

echo 'Created contact: ';
print_r($contact);
?>

steps.title: Step 6: Test Your Agent with a Phone Call
steps.content:
Now let's test your agent by making an actual phone call.

Option 1: Test in the Dashboard

  1. Go to your agent in the "Agents" section
  2. Click on your agent to view details
  3. Click the "Test Agent" button
  4. Enter a phone number to call
  5. Click "Start Call"

nextSteps.title: What's Next?
nextSteps.description: Congratulations! 🎉 You've successfully set up your first AI agent and made your first API calls. Here's what you can explore next:

cards.title: Advanced Agent Settings
cards.description: Learn about custom tools, webhooks, and advanced prompting techniques.

cards.title: Set Up Phone Numbers
cards.description: Connect your own phone numbers for inbound and outbound calls.

cards.title: Create Campaigns
cards.description: Set up automated calling campaigns with dial lists and scheduling.

cards.title: Build Smart Flows
cards.description: Create complex conversation flows with branching logic.

sections.title: API Key Not Working
points: Ensure you're using the correct header: x-api-key
Check that your API key hasn't expired
Verify the key has the necessary permissions

sections.title: Agent Not Responding
points: Check that your agent is active (not paused)
Verify your voice provider credentials are configured
Ensure you have sufficient credits in your account

sections.title: Calls Not Connecting
points: Verify phone numbers are in E.164 format (+1234567890)
Check that your SIP provider is properly configured
Ensure your account has calling credits

support.title: Need Help?
support.content:
If you run into any issues or have questions:

  • 📧 Email us at support@imash.io
  • 💬 Join our Discord community
  • 📚 Check out our API Reference for detailed documentation
  • 🎥 Watch our video tutorials for step-by-step guides
